body:
Comment 2: 
See pending CL http://golang.org/cl/6206073 .

In case of only empty statements, an empty line persists because go/printer respects the
existing line distance between statements (up to at most one). In this block:

{
;;;;;
}

There is one extra line (the empty statements) between { and } and thus the result will
preserve that line. This is independent of this fix.
